greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: first column: top entry is 1, then powers of 2; rest of triangle is Pascal's triangle A007318.
comment: The original definition of A135233 made no sense. In fact A135233 is the binomial transform of the present sequence.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of triangle, flattened
maple: seq(seq(T(n, k), k=0..n), n=0..12); # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
mathematica: Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 12}, {k, 0, n}]//Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019 *)
program: (PARI) T(n,k) = if(k==n, 1, if(k==0, 2^(n-1), binomial(n-1, k-1) )); \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
if k eq n then return 1;
end if; return T; end function;
[T(n,k): k in [0..n], n in [0..12]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
[[T(n, k) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..12)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 30 2011
